intro: Aspidium tasmaniae, commonly known as the Tasmanian water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Tasmania. It is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Aspidium tasmaniae plays an important ecological role in aquatic habitats by providing shelter for small aquatic organisms.
